text: Touraj Daryaee (; born 1967) is an Iranologist and historian. He is from Iran. He works as the director of the Dr. Samuel M. Jordan Center for Persian Studies at the University of California, Irvine.https://www.faculty.uci.edu/profile.cfm?faculty_id=5432 UCI Faculty Profile Retrieved 2020-16-06. He got a Ph.D. in History at the University of California, Los Angeles in 1999. He has taught at UCLA. He is the editor of the Name-ye Iran-e Bastan, The International Journal of Ancient Iranian Studies and the DABIR: Digital Ar. He is also the director of the Sasanika Project, a project on the history and culture of Sasanians.https://farhang.org/2015/studies-of-ancient-iran-receive-support- from-farhang-foundation Studies of Ancient Iran receive support from Farhang Foundation Retrieved 2020-16-06. His most famous books are Sasanian Persia: The Rise and Fall of an Empire and Sasanian Iran (224-651 CE): Portrait of a Late Antique Empire.https://www.oxfordhandbooks.com/view/10.1093/oxfordhb/9780199732159.001.0001/oxfordhb-9780199732159 Oxford Handbook of Iranian History Retrieved 2020-16-06. == Publications == Daryaee has written many publications. His book, Sasanian Persia: The Rise and Fall of an Empire, in 2010 received multiple awards by BRISMES and the British-Kuwait Friendship Society Prize in Middle Eastern Studies.http://www.payvand.com/news/10/dec/1024.html Sasanian Persia wins the BRISMES Prize Retrieved 2020-16-06. === Selected Books === * The Parthian and Early Sasanian Empires: adaptation and expansion, eds.
